note.p: Education: King's College, London; Christ Church, Oxford. MA (Oxon)

Career: Professor of Botany, Royal College of Science, Ireland (1870); Professor of Botany, Agricultural College, Cirencester; Professor of Botany, Royal Horticultural Society; Examiner in Botany, University of London; Assistant Director (1875-1885), then Director (1885-1905), Royal Gardens Kew; resigned from the Royal Society (17 May 1917)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1930 vol 106 pp xxiii-xxix, by Francis Wall Oliver
References: E M Tansey, 'George Eliot's Support for Physiology: the George Henry Lewes Trust 1879-1939' in NR 1990 vol 44 pp 221-240
